fields.description:
When I drag a file into a page from my computer's dock using the Safari browser, it doesn't attach it on the first attempt. If I drag the same file to the same page and drop it in exactly the same location, it works on the second attempt. From that time it seems I can drag files successfully from the dock to the page.

Steps to reproduce:
(in Safari)
# Create a new page
# Drag an image from a folder on the dock and drop it on the page
(The image shouldn't attach)
# Drag the same file to the page and drop it in the same location
(The image should successfully attach)
fields.summary: Drag and drop from dock doesn't work on first attempt in Safari

fields.description:
h3. Summary
You cannot upload a file larger than 2GB through 'Upload file', while you can by Drag & Drop (See also attachmentPage.jpg)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install vanilla Confluence 5.8.10 using H2SQL (I guess DB does not matter)
# Configure _Attachment Maximum Size_ to accept up to 10GB
# Create a space and a page
# Go to attachment (_/pages/viewpageattachments.action?pageId=<PAGE-ID>_) of the page
# Try to upload a file larger than 2GB through 'Upload file'

h3. Expected Results
The file larger than 2GB can be uploaded successfully

h3. Actual Results
- The file larger than 2GB cannot be uploaded. The user will be redirected to _/pages/doattachfile.action?pageId=<PAGE-ID>_, which does not exist. See also _redirect.jpg_.
- The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-confluence.log file:

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Confluence Page properties report Macro doesn't show values when key string is linked to a page with the same name. 

h3. Step to replicate
# Create a space (test)
# Create the following page under the home page
# * Attribute1
# * Attribute2alt
#* Object1
# Edit the page {{Object1}} then do the following table inside a page properties macro. The Attribute1 is linked to the page "Attribute1" and Attribute2 is linked to page "Attribute2alt"
!sample.png|thumbnail!
# Create a page Summary then add a page properties report macro in the page to show the page properties that we previously created.Ensure that you added the Attribute1,Attribute2,Attribute3 in the {{Column to show}}
!sample2.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Expected Result.
All value is shown

h3.Observed Result
Only column which that are not linked or linked to a page with a different name are shown.
All the value for the column is shown
!sample2.png|thumbnail! 

*Extra Note*
This issue does not occur if you remove the value from {{Column to show}}.

Sample of affected space [here|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/173611/Confluence-space-export-140752-3.xml.zip]
fields.summary: Confluence Page properties report Macro doesn't show values when key string is linked to a page with the same name

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39283].
  {panel}

Currently when pressing the 'e' shortcut to edit a page, the page is opened in editing mode. However, the page is always opened at the top, independently from the part of the page you were viewing before (in viewing mode). For large pages this is very cumbersome, since you have to scroll all the way down in the editing view when you were viewing the end of the page before. Moreover, if there are a lot of macros on the page, the similarity between edit mode and viewing mode is often quite low, which only makes the searching to the right spot in the editing view even more time consuming.

I suggest following improvement:
* When pressing 'e': in the editing mode jump directly to the text line which was displayed at the top of the browser screen in the viewing mode.
* If the "double-click to edit" functionality is provided: jump to the line where the double-click occured.
fields.summary: Edit improvement: Directing to correct page location

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39282].
  {panel}

Inline comments needs some improvements with respect to traceability of comments over Confluence page versions. Currently it is not possible to trace:
* In which page version each comment was added.
* [In which page versions each comment was present (after adding, until being resolved).]
* In what page version each comment has been resolved.
* Overview of unresolved comments

I request following improvements:
* Show the comments related to a page also when viewing an older version of a page, not only in the current version.
* Extend the "Resolved comments" screen to a general comment overview showing at least: unresolved comments, resolved comments, version of adding, version of resolving.

These concepts are crucial for a decent reviewing process.
fields.summary: Improve tracking of inline comments

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Chart plugin is bundled with Confluence, but on some previous versions it appears as incompatible when running the Confluence update checker.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Confluence 5.5.7 (for example), run the update checker 
# Look for the chart plugin

h3. Expected Results
As this plugin is bundled, the test should fail

h3. Actual Results
This plugin fails the update check

h3.Workaround
There is currently no workaround for this. We just need to update the plugin version compatibility in the following page: https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/confluence.extra.chart/versions
fields.summary: Update Chart plugin compatibility to the latest version

Thanks!

h3. Summary
Confluence cannot export a page as Word file when the page contains Two Dimension Filters.
This problem occurred only in Two Dimension Filters. (not in the other JIRA Chart Macros.)
This problem occurred only when lines in JIRA Charts are more than 5.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Prepare a JIRA instance with a project and issues assigned to more than 5 assignees
# Setup Confluence with an Application Link to the JIRA instance
# Create a page
# Insert a *Two Dimensional JIRA Chart* macro with Assignee selected for "YAxis" and *Rows to display* seto to 5 or less (in order to have the "Show more" link like the following screenshot):
!show_more.png|thumbnail!
# Export the page as Word file

The page is exported as Word file.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39259].
  {panel}

Any plugin in Confluence that provides a web item in the admin section gets a page header with the text of the web item on it.

This is all cool for simple plugins/pages, but is actually quite a massive pain for more complex  UIs, some examples:
* different page header than the link text
* customize the header to contain extra components

Confluence should support a param on the web-item that would allow to opt-out of the obligatory page header.
fields.summary: Ability for plugins to opt out of admin page header

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39256].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
In Server instance, Confluence only users won't be able to view JIRA Issue Macro details added to Confluence Pages.

h3. Suggested Solution
Confluence pages will still refresh and work, but not click through to JIRA, when a user has no JIRA access. In conclusion - the macro would still pull whatever content you want it to show (display options) and be able to refresh (in realtime), but the user will not be able to click through if they don't have JIRA access.
fields.summary: Allow Confluence only users to have read only access on JIRA Issue Macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39249].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently a SPACE admin can allow anonymous (non-registered) users view-only privileges for their space - but only if the SITE admin has "granted the global ‘Use Confluence’ permission". This works as expected - however it opens a security hole. The SPACE admin can now extend write permissions to anonymous users.
           

h3. Suggested Solution
This type of access should be in the control of the SITE admin. It would be nice for the SITE admin to have the ability to specify what anonymous permissions the SPACE admin can allow.
fields.summary: Allow system admin to have the ability to specify what anonymous permissions space administrators can grant

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39247].
  {panel}

It would be nice to be able to change the color of the search bar.

The reason of this is because I'm *color-blind* and I have problem differentiating blue tones. 
When we first installed Confluence, I was hearing everybody in my team saying that we could search pages but I never found it until someone clearly pointed out where I needed to click in order to search. 

Even now, I'm not sure where I need to click to search pages. 

I suggest that we could change the color of the "Search bar" per user so you don't have to change the full Confluence template to accommodate color-blind people and allow each user to change it if they want or make a special style for color-blind people that they can activate in their profile.
fields.summary: Give the ability to set the color of the "Search bar" per user/profile

We have a problem with several of our Confluence pages. I have now observed problems on three different computers all using Chrome.

On certain pages, where we have a Gliffy diagram, the pages load, are shown for a second or two and then Chrome crashes. However if you open the Console (F12) and then reloads the page it does not. The same thing doesn't happen in IE.

Cheers

Martin

fields.description:
This is probably a duplicate and you'll mark it as minor, but it's really very annoying. 

Confluence behaves as you would expect If you highlight text starting at the left and swipe to the right. With the selection enabled, type something. It overwrites the highlighted text and enters the new text. 

But if you highlight from the right towards the left and type, it wipes out the selected text AND jumps the cursor to the top of the page. This may only happen if you select all the way to the left margin; that's where I notice it the most.

I know, you're going to say "well stop highlighting from the right then" -- but I've been doing it for 20 years and it's a hard habit to break :)
fields.summary: Cursor jumps to top of page if you select text from right to left

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39239].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Don't count {{my:favourite}} label (invisible) as 'Labels' in Contributors Summary Macro

h3. Environment
Confluence 5.8.10

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create any type of page
# Set *Contributors Summary Macro* on the page
# Set the page as the current user's 'Favourite'

h3. Expected Results
I don't want the macro to count {{my:favourite}} as 'Labels' like following.

||Users||Edits||Comments||Labels||
|current user|0|0|{color:red}0{color}|

h3. Actual Results
The macro counts {{my:favourite}} as 'Labels' like following.

||Users||Edits||Comments||Labels||
|current user|0|0|{color:red}1{color}|

h3. Notes
Unless {{my:favourite}} label is visible, it shouldn't be counted as 'Labels' in Contributors Summary Macro because the users might worried about the mismatch between the number on the table and sum of visible labels.
fields.summary: Don't count my:favourite label as 'Labels' in Contributors Summary Macro

Clicking on it should go to the "Edit user profile picture" page ({{/users/profile/editmyprofilepicture.action}}) but instead goes to {{/users/editmyprofilepicture.action}}
fields.summary: Broken "Edit user profile picture"

fields.description:
I'm guessing this is related to Confluence 5.9.1-pluginsfour-013 upgrading to the rest3. 

Installing an add-on from the Atlassian Marketplace works by searching for it and installing it. 

However if I manually upload it (or submit it as a url) the p2 add-on doesn't get installed. I get an error saying "An unexpected error occurred. Refer to the logs for more information." Looking in the logs doesn't show me anything. However looking in the javascript console, I see that a call to /rest/plugins/1.0/?token=[some number] fails with a 403. 

Looking at what's being submitted - it's a multipart form data with the content so the data and the response is "XSRF check failed".

Not sure where to submit this. So I'm submitting it both to the Confluence project and to the UPM project and hopefully one of them is the right place since if this goes out to the public add-on vendors won't be able to submit patch releases.
fields.summary: Unable to upload an add-on jar (or submit a url) through Add-on Manager
Ability to Restrict Add-ons/Macros to Groups in Confluence

fields.description:
Since upgrading Confluence to version 5.8.x, we get connection timeouts after 20s (default connection timeout of HTTP connector in server.xml) when trying to load non-batched JavaScript files.

*Steps to reproduce this issue:*
# Use a fresh Confluence 5.8.x instance
# Try to load any *.js file from the includes folder in your browser. Example: http://localhost:8090/includes/js/moment/moment.js
# It may be displayed if your browser has already cached the file, but when you force reload the file (shift refresh), the browser keeps loading the file and fails after 20 seconds.

It looks like only JavaScript files are affected by this, images or CSS files are loaded correctly. We were able to reproduce this in any modern browser.

We recognized this when trying to add a user to a group in Confluence. The user picker/search popup doesn't seem to work anymore. It looks like it tries to load the file */includes/js/entity_picker.js*, which also results in a connection timeout. We've also added some custom JS files (for analytics) in the includes folder and referenced them in the custom HTML section. This used to work perfectly in Confluence versions < 5.8.x, but doesn't seem to work anymore.

We are using Confluence 5.8.10, but I was also able to reproduce this in a fresh Confluence 5.8.4 instance. Any help would be appreciated.
fields.summary: Connection timeout when trying to load non-batched JavaScript files in 5.8.x

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39209].
  {panel}

Confluence shows the owner as _Unknown User (username)_ in the content owner after removing the external user from the application.

*Steps to Replicate*
1. Add a user to the LDAP that can log into Confluence. Let's call it *test1*.
2. Log in as an admin, sync the LDAP directory on Confluence so the app is aware of the user, then Log Out as admin.
3. Log in as the new user (test1).
4. Click on "Add personal space" in the Create Space screen.
5. Copy the URL of the Space home page.
6. Log out as test1.
7. Remove the user from the LDAP/group.
8. Log in as admin and perform a directory sync, make sure the user does not exist any longer.
9. Access the space created by test1 user (the url we've copied).

*Expected results*
The space/page should keep the name of the content owner, keeping their footprint.

*Current results*
We see _Unknown User (test1)_ username as owner of the space.

*Workaround*
https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=740001947
fields.summary: Unknown User (username) in the content owner after deleting user

  {panel}

As a user who meets with consistent failures to export a large Confluence space to PDF
I want to be able to
* diagnose the situation i.e. retrieve the full list of problematic pages without finding them one by one
* have a way to *exclude* all problematic pages from exported PDF automatically (and possibly have some "error report" listing them)
* possibly have all potentially problematic pages (based on information from existing JIRA tickets, for example) highlighted on the "Custom Export" screen / have number such potential problems displayed on "Export" screen to simplify life to those who don't expect problem with the content

So that i do not have to spent enormous amount of time trying to figure out the problematic pages one by one, let alone having to uncheck them in hard-to-navigate (for larger spaces with 100+ pages) checkbox-tree

Support ticket for reference: JST-151418

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39197].
  {panel}

When using a newer version of Firefox, if you have installed the webdav connector add-on for Firefox and click on the link edit on office at the attachment screen, nothing happens. Additionally, if the WebDAV Launcher add-on is not installed, you are not prompted to install it.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a vanilla Firefox
# Go to a Confluence page with an Office Document
# Click Edit in Office (or go to Tools - Attachments and try to edit in office from there)
#- You *should* be prompted to install the WebDAV connector at this point, according to [this document|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Installing+the+Firefox+Add-On+for+the+Office+Connector], but you are not.
# Install the add-on manually
# Try to edit the document again
#- Still, nothing happens, as thought the button or link has no action attached.

h3. Workaround
This behaviour occurs because the WebDAV Launcher has not been configured. You will need to install the connector manually, then configure it following [this document|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Installing+the+Firefox+Add-On+for+the+Office+Connector]. You will then be able to Edit in Office through Firefox.

h3. Hopes and Dreams
The behaviour of the WebDAV connector could be improved, to show an error or warning if the add on has not been configured. Our documentation indicates that the user will be taken to the download location if the add-on is not installed, so this should also occur.
fields.summary: Edit in office doesn't work in Firefox, if WebDAV Launcher configuration not being complete. Improve this to include a useful error for the user.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39185].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update, October 29 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Hi all,

Thanks for providing your thoughts and votes on this suggestion.

As you’re probably aware, we made significant improvements to our editing files experience in our 6.11 release, allowing users to both edit any file type, and do so without having to manually download the file and reupload their changes. For more information on these improvements, please see our [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/edit-files-170494553.html].

However, as part of these immediate changes we decided not to implement concurrent editing. To prevent this issue arising there is an add-on available ([Cenote Lockpoint|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/36199/cenote-lockpoint-attachment-checkout?tab=overview&hosting=server]) which offers the ability to lock documents while they’re being edited. 

We do though understand the value concurrent editing would bring, and will reconsider this suggestion at a later date.

Best
Jenny | Confluence Server Product Manager

{panel}

If there is an Office file embedded on a page and two users start editing it in Office at the same time. The first one to save his/her changes will have the changes uploaded to Confluence. The other one that saves after the first is not able to save at all. Office seems to be puzzled when the file has changed form. Office does not show the changes and does not allow saving. It does not even say that the save has not been made. It just does not save.

This is bad if a lot of changes have been made and it does not inform of the problem. Someone might just save and close the window and realize later that nothing was actually saved and nothing can be found in the version history.
fields.summary: Concurrent editing of files for the Office Connector

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39180].
  {panel}

*Summary*

As of now, {{viewfile}} macro does not provide an option on how to render the attachment into Confluence page. as seen on the following screenshot

!viewfile.png|thumbnail!

When rendered into a page, it can only be view into a fllscreen with no other option to change the way it rendered into the page

!view.png|thumbnail!

It would be great if options such as

* Scroll down mode view instead of page by page
* Configurable height and width
* Zoom in and out feature
* Add title
* Configurable border

*Workaround*

In order to add more parameter to render your PDF file you can use [{{wikimarkup}}|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+Wiki+Markup] macro on Confluence 4.x and use display image macro as describe [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF35/Displaying+an+Image] which have variety of parameters to use. For example

{code}
!UserManual.pdf|height=700,width=975,id=media!{code}
fields.summary: Provide more option to render attachment using viewfile macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39178].
  {panel}

Hi,

we are looking forward to switch our whole process documentation for our subsidiaries from Word to Confluence. 
The already existing documentation is formatted in word with headings, so while doing the import we can choose weather to create sub-topics or not. As we often have really big manuals this makes totally sense. After importing some test manuals we noticed that unfortunately the order of the subtopics created out of the headings in word is just alphabetical! There is no way to get the old structure back. For example you have a document with three headings.

Documentname = My Thesis
TOC
1. Introduction
2. Main Part
3. End

From this results in Confluence:
A page "My thesis" with the TOC shown above
and the three children introduction, main part and end. In the side bar and the child macro those topics get shown in an alphabetical order. That means I get as list

* End
* Introduction
* Main Part

That makes navigating with the sidebar basically useless. Therefore I ideally would suggest two options:
1. Allow importing the number of the numbered heading from word to the title of the page so sorting works out automatically

2. Allow chronological sorting as kind of work around to show at least the correct order of pages
fields.summary: Allow importing of numbered headings from word while doing a split up
